1.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

2.text: The same was in the beginning with God.

3.text: All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.

4.text: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.

5.text: And the light shineth in the darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.

16.text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

17.text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.

1.text: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.

2.text: In my Father's house are many mansions: if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.

3.text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto myself; that where I am, there ye may be also.

6.text: Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.

27.text: Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.

1.text: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

2.text: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

3.text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.

4.text: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.

5.text: I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.

9.text: As the Father hath loved me, so have I loved you: continue ye in my love.

10.text: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments, and abide in his love.

11.text: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.

12.text: This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.

13.text: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

16.text: Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

17.text: These things I command you, that ye love one another.
